review_text: From the moment we stepped into Katie's place we felt right at home! The place smelled and looked amazing! The bed is quite comfortable and the fireplace makes the room cozier. The room is bigger than we realized, which was amazing! There is another room where my husband was able to read in the husband and not disturb me while I slept. The kitchen amenities were perfect and made our 4 day stay pleasant. Our plans changed last minute and Katie was accommodating in allowing us to have a very late check-out. Highly recommend this AirBnB and will stay here again for our next visit to Rochester if necessary!

Stayed over a week
review_text:
Best AirBnB I've ever stayed in by far!!
Spent almost 4 months at this amazing place for work at Mayo, and it was as comfortable as any place I've ever stayed.
Inside is extremely cozy with a lovely fireplace and plenty of place for your stuff.
The hosts Katie and Fred are wonderful, extremely accommodating and responsive to any of your requests, regularly provide free coffee and a once a month cleaning if you are here for longer stays, and always went above and beyond to make my stay In Rochester for work amazing.
There is probably plenty of great stuff about this place I forgot to mention, and it's because my long experience here was so exceptionally great overall.
If I'm ever back in Rochester, I would immediately look to see if this awesome place is available to stay in again!
Warm regards,
Roland

name: Katelynn
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My husband & I stayed at Katie’s home for a week while visiting Mayo Clinic. This location was wonderful because it was about 6 minutes from Mayo. It was extremely close to shopping & restaurants as well which was very convenient. A Mall, Trader Joe’s & Chick-fil-A where also very close.
The home was very clean. The kitchen was great! Everything was new or updated. You could tell Katie has put a lot of care into this space. The reason I gave it 3 out of 5 stars is because I feel the 2 doors leading into this space could have more secure locks. As a woman, this is something I pay attention to at homes. Also, the bathroom situation I feel should have been described better in the listing. The bathroom does not have much privacy. One of the walls is glass and there is a sliding barn door that doesn’t actually close. So it can be very uncomfortable if you are potty shy. That was a big bummer for me.
Over all this space was very well put together, clean and close to a lot of things.

This place is great! It's really nicely decorated and cozy. The fireplace is amazing.
She left many kitchen and bathroom amenities (and a toothbrush, advil to top) for me. Many towels and bed linens.
The place is calm and the neighbourhood is really nice. Walkable to St Mary's. If you are going to downtown Mayo and don't want to walk (not a lot of walking, around 20 blocks) you can trait the shuttle that goes every 30 min.
Shopping center 15 min walking. In fact, I didn't rent a car.
I hope to be coming back to mayo in 2025, the first thing I'll do is book this place.
There is no other place so aesthetically pleasing for that price in rochester, in my opinion. Even more expensive place were not as nice.

review_text:
Katie's place was immaculate, beautiful, and well-appointed -- it exceeded what I expected from the description! I was visiting the Mayo Clinic during the freezing "bomb cyclone" and this semi-basement apartment was extremely cozy and elegant at the same time, with every amenity I could ever need, and a warm gas fireplace. If it hadn't been so cold it would have been walkable to town too. Katie was wonderful to work with as well -- super responsive, thoughtful, and helpful. I felt so lucky to have stayed in this "rare find." I'd highly recommend it, and hope to stay again on future visits.
Katie's driving directions are important! I used Ubers and taxis to get around, and some GPS providers don't seem to be aware that the street the apartment is on is one-way, so you have to tell them.

She has been the best host by far we have ever had. I would love to stay there again if we needed to go back. So close to the main streets and easy to find. Katie was amazing.

review_text: I cannot rave enough about Katie's place. It was utterly charming! The pictures do not do it justice. We were in Rochester before the holidays to help house hunt. Consequently, we were all over town as well as at the hospital and downtown. It was the perfect location and the best place to decompress afterwards. Everything was sparkling clean with a eye to detail that meant we never needed anything. In addition, the fireplace and décor created the most cozy and inviting space. Katie was a great host! She was extremely responsive to any questions we had. We would definitely stay here again and not only highly recommend her property but have already mentioned it to others coming to the area.

·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Katie was so friendly and accommodating. The only time I needed something, she responded very quickly. The house was perfect for our 3+ week trip to the Mayo Clinic, and if it hadn't been so cold, we could have walked there in 10-15 minutes, as it's about 7/10 of a mile from the St. Mary's campus. The kitchen was adequately stocked with plates, utensils, cookware, bakeware, etc., coffee supplies, paper towels, trash bags, and a few basic seasonings. The bedroom was comfortable and clean. The bathroom has an unusual design, but we got used to it...a sliding barn door will only cover the toilet area or the shower area, but not both, so there's not a lot of privacy. We adjusted by one person staying out of sight while the other used that part of the apartment. I would recommend this apartment and Katie!

Stayed about a week
review_text:
The place was lovely like the pictures shown. The description was very clear (be sure to look at all the specifics). The host was kind, helpful and responsive to questions.
I didn’t end up staying even a night (planned for 10 days) because of a concern related to seeing a couple of bugs within a few hours - one crawled on my arm when I was laying in bed. It created stress that I didn’t need and unfortunately I ended up paying for two spaces to sleep (not getting fully refunded) while in MN because that wasn’t the right fit for me.
I personally didn’t want to wonder when the next bug may do it’s thing. Again for some it may be a non-issue but it was for me. I’m not sure if immediately anything could be done to resolve it yet. The host shared that the owner sprayed for bugs which resulted in my experience. It doesn’t seem to be one that was shared previously so perhaps I was the “lucky” one.

review_text: Katie provides a warm, cozy space for any traveler looking to visit Rochester. Her communication and recommendations were most helpful to us on our trip. As a host, she has thought of everything a traveler might need in terms of kitchen and bathroom essentials while providing a relaxing space to unwind after a long day. Her space reflects attention to cleanliness and organization as well. We hope her space is available in the future when we return to Rochester.

This is the second time we've stayed at Yinghui's place based on our past experience. The residence works great for us when we visit Rochester and the Mayo Clinic. First, it is clean and comfortable place to stay. Second, the various Mayo facilities are easily assessable. Third, it is conveniently located as far as going to restaurants. Fourth, it is in a nice neighborhood to walk (in our case we walk our dog). And fifth, and perhaps most important, Yinhui allows dogs and her place includes a kennel so we don't have to bring ours with use.
Overall, a great place to stay. And hopefully it will be available when we visit next year.

name: Bailee
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Overall a lovely weekend at this place.
The pros are the home was as-described with comfortable beds and it was close to several restaurants and local shops. Charming little house and Yinghui was very communicative and helpful. I appreciated our check-in and checkout was swift, it was very smooth to get in and out of the home.
Some cons were the floor boards were very squeaky so getting up in the middle of the night woke up our dog every time. The XL dog kennel was not as large as I had hoped, it did fit our dog but would be a better fit for medium-small dogs. We were very excited about the fenced-in backyard, however we were disappointed the fencing was only waist-high in some areas, easily jumped over by our 50 lb aussie-mix, so she could'nt be off-leash like we had hoped.
In all, a nice and comfortable stay for the weekend. We would book here again!

Having the fenced space in the back and the dog crate and the option to bring our dog made it feel so like home! There were fresh flowers all over and the house itself has been updated beautifully. The hosts were super attentive and very responsive to messages. I would love to stay again.

We’ll do it again- love having our critters with us and they love not being in a kennel.

The first thing I like to do after a long drive is make a nice cold drink, so a cpl of ice cube trays in the freezer wld be nice. Other than that, all we wld have needed to bring was clothes. She went above and beyond to provide gluten free snacks for us and ran over some flashlights when a storm took out the power briefly. Communication was timely and efficient. The home is well-equipped and has all the comforts needed. The location is in close proximity to the Mayo Clinic, just a short 5 minute drive. My husband and our dog Callie took advantage of the walking trails that are just steps away from the house.
This is a gem and we will definitely be back in our future Mayo Clinic visits.

Stayed with kids
review_text: I highly recommend Blue Vista. Several family members from out of town stayed there while we were all visiting family in Rochester. The location is amazing, we all took advantage of the park and trail access just across the street for walks, and several of us used the bikes provided in the garage to explore the trail system along the rivers in Rochester. Morning coffee on the front porch overlooking the park and river was a great way to start every day. The house was clean and tidy, had everything we needed to be comfortable, and offered an excellent place for people to gather for meals and socializing. Tony was proactive and accommodating, knowing we had an infant in our party, and made sure we had what we needed, including a pack & play and other resources. The bedrooms had blackout curtains, so it was great for those who wanted to sleep in, even with early morning light of late spring (and for daytime naps for the infant).

Stayed with kids
review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed every moment at this great house. We needed to travel to Rochester for appointments at Mayo and let me say, this home is the PERFECT place to stay. From the location, a single mile away from the main Mayo campus and across the street from a great park that both my kids loved, to the coziness and comfort of the house itself, we greatly enjoyed the bonus movie room upstairs, this house met and exceeded all of our needs. The bedding was warm and the mattresses comfortable, more than enough bathroom towels and washcloths were provided for our family of four, and the shampoo and body dispensers were a great touch. The large collection of board/card games and movies provided hours of fun. Also, the personalized welcome message and the snack station were great appreciated and enjoyed. All and all, this home made, what we worried would be a difficult trip, so very easy. We would stay at this place again in a heartbeat.

The unit was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the front porch looking out toward downtown Rochester was a lovely place to "hang out". We had the tiniest glitch in getting the correct security code to get in, but Tony answered promptly and it was a non-event. His responsiveness was impressive. We will stay here again, I'm sure!

review_text: Blue Vista is a great place to stay if you need to be in Rochester. The reviews from most if not all the people that have posted are positive and so is mine. The location is wonderful, with a walking trail along the water, families of ducks and geese with one's own private Duck Crossing in the front yard, a big front porch from which to watch the world go by and an easy walk to restaurants and the Mayo Clinic. Inside is casually chic, large, easy to live in, and with super amenities thoughtfully provided - for example, have you misplaced your reading glasses? Check the shelf where you will find a supply. Coloring books, games, generous TV with Netflix, a very thoughtful collection. The kitchen is easy to use and has what you'll need to cook. The car got to stay in the garage. Bazillions of towels. I recommend that you stay here while in Rochester. Note: stairs to get in and out of the house and the downstairs bathroom is a bit away from the downstairs bedroom; no issue if you are ambulatory.

The neighborhood is quiet, but within walking distance to downtown Mayo, many restaurants and right across the street from Mayo Park. The kitchen is well-stocked, the bathrooms are clean, and the beds/bedding are very cozy! Tony and Teresa are very attentive hosts. They are quick to respond to any communication, are very accommodating and seem to be able to anticipate our needs. All in all, everything I could possibly want from an AirBnB host! Many people come to the community of Rochester to seek medical care from the Mayo System, this can obviously be a stressful experience. It's incredibly comforting to know that at Blue Vista one can count on a safe, relaxing environment. Thank you Tony & Teresa!

We ended up having to extend an extra week and were so thrilled that they could accommodate our longer stay.
Everything was so well appointed, from the Kitchen with spices and literally everything one could want to the well-stocked Baths and great linens on the beds. Everything was so comfortable and we will definitely be back some day. So happy to have found this incredible home and hosts, can't say enough good things about them and our experience.

name: Dana
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

September 2020
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Blue Vista is everything it claims to be and more! The entire house is so comfortable and stylish! The kitchen is well stocked! We cooked nearly every meal there and never lacked for utensils or cookware! The refrigerator has chilled water and an ice maker. The living room is very comfortable and there was plenty of space for the six of us. We enjoyed hanging out and watching Netflix and Hulu! Each of the bedrooms is roomy with very comfortable beds and bedding! The upstairs movie room was a hit with our kids! They loved being able to have their own space and play a game or choose a movie from Blue Vista’s extensive movie collection! Both bathrooms were very clean and it was so nice to have two of them! Actually the whole house was shockingly clean! We’ve stayed in many AirBnBs around the world and this was by far the cleanest!
We spent many afternoons sitting on the lovely patio at the back of the house. It has a table and several chairs and is shaded by a beautiful catalpa tree. The house also has a really great front porch overlooking a park. There are two rocking chairs and in the evenings we’d sit and watch the ducks from the park waddle over and pass through the yard for some unknown destination. This was a surprisingly entertaining and relaxing time.
Overall I would highly recommend Blue Vista! Tony was an excellent communicator, always responding within a minute or two. He and Teresa clearly take pride in this property and for that reason this is a great place to stay!

The house reflected pride from its owners who made it a priority to accommodate every want and need we could have. From beginning to end, Tony & Teresa communicated promptly with us and made us feel special. The house was so comfortable. It made you not want to leave it, but at the same time there was plenty to do in the area so we ventured out every day to explore and be active. We had our bikes and kayaks with us, as well as strength training gear, so we were able to continue our active lifestyle just as we would do at home. And it was good that we did because the food that we had at the local restaurants that they recommended was amazing! We highly recommend Blue Vista if you plan to be in Rochester!

name: Megan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Brooke's place did not dissapoint! It was just as pictured, easy to find, has its own designated parking and it is close to Mayo! Shops are a short drive and easy to get to from this location.
I was having surgery the day after we arrived so the first thing I did when I arrived was wipe down all commonly touched surfaces with a lysol wipe and there was not a speck of dust or dirt on anything! It was very clean!
The kitchen was nicely stocked. The bathroom had more than enough supplies to last us our 9 day stay. We didnt need to purchase anything additional for our comfort or needs.
The beds were comfortable for both me and my husband. Normally beds, not my own, hurt my back but I was comfortable and slept very well.
The shower is a unique space as described. It was weird at first showering in an open space but it ended up being something we didnt know we needed!! I needed help to shower post surgery and the open shower allowed for that to be easily accomplished!
Brooke was top notch on communication and very responsive! She checked in during our stay to make sure we had everything we needed. We asked for a broom to sweep up some crumbs and before I saw the email response, the broom was at our door.
After check out, Brooke messaged me to let us know we left something behind and kindly offered to mail it. Luckily, we were still in Rochester and was able to go back and pick it up!
I highly recommend! Brooke is a great host and she will make your stay perfect and stress free. We will definitely stay here again for any future stays in Rochester!

name: Kara

,

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Our purpose for our visit to Rochester was to see family and friends. It was just my husband and I as well as our dog. Allowing pets was a plus for us and one of the main reasons we chose this property. Overall, the house met our needs - it had space to sprawl out and work remotely (if you needed to), a garage to park our vehicle in each night and was VERY clean. It is evident that Rebecka gives a lot of thought and care to ensure her guests have a nice stay. All the basics were taken care of - from extra toiletries, towels, kitchen supplies, cleaning supplies, plenty of seating and easy check-in/check-out with a personalized note/instructions upon arrival.
The location of this property is on a corner lot, which faces the main street/through-way in this neighborhood. While not very busy, it has somewhat limited privacy from that aspect. However, the backside of the house is lined with a wooded area - which offered the opposite. Good privacy and if you are lucky, like we were, you will see deer walk through the backyard to graze each evening. We also took advantage of many walks in this neighborhood, which was quiet and safe.
The main floor of the house has ample windows for natural light and includes the kitchen, dining, living room, reading/sitting area, half bath and one additional bedroom/office that has a set of sliding doors with access to a small deck (which faces front or the main road). The finished basement level offers 3 bedrooms, including the master with en-suite bathroom, one additional full bath, the laundry room and a center living area and/or work area(s). The master bedroom is a good size and nicely appointed with a full en-suite bathroom (tub/shower combo), king-sized foam mattress (which we found to be comfortable), TV as well as walk-in closet, dresser and bookshelf for storage. We did not need the other bedrooms, but each seemed to have all the basics - closet, hangers, extra towels, laundry basket, TV, nightstands and/or dresser, but with smaller beds.
Overall, our stay was very nice. The house met our expectations, provided the accommodations we needed and was a good value.
Our thanks to Rebecka, for being a 'Super Host' - we appreciated your attention to detail and ensuring our visit was a good one!

I hope it is always available for future stays! Thanks Pamela for the beautiful and stress free stay! Luv u all.

The affordability was a pleasant surprise, especially considering the upscale features. The well equipped game area added an extra layer of enjoyment, making it an ideal choice for my family’s relaxation and entertainment. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a spacious, stylish and comfortable rental!

review_text: This house is a great value, especially if you need 4 bedrooms. The location is great, right next to St. Mary's Hospital and close to the Mayo Clinic (1 mile walk). Beautiful neighborhood. Garage. You can tell the kitchen and bathrooms have been recently remodeled, with new appliances. The listing describes everything accurately and be sure to read it. The stairs are quite narrow and steep, and we found them difficult to navigate, especially at the top where the bannister ends. There is a "stain" policy mentioned in the listing, and that applies to towels (we found several of them stained which especially caused concern because the guests are asked to do the towel laundry upon departure and not the professional cleaners).

Stayed with kids
review_text:
This house was such a great find! A wonderful house with an excellent location! The house is so spacious and was perfect for me, my husband, our 6 children and my mom.
We were able to walk to the Mayo building in 20 minutes. When it was raining, we walked across the alley and street to the Mary Brigh entrance of St. Mary’s and then took the free Mayo shuttle.
The house is in a charming neighborhood. We enjoyed walking around the block and we found a school with a fun playground about 3 blocks away. You are also within a block of a McDonald’s and KFC. Several other restaurants are also within walking distance.
The house had beautiful and comfortable furnishings. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook the food we brought.
The sleeping situation was great. We had 2 bedrooms on the first floor and 2 on the second floor, which was perfect for us.
Denise was super helpful, welcoming and responsive. Thanks for the great stay! I highly recommend this house for your family.

My only feedback would be to let people know that when u come in the back door and it's dark or you haven't been there to watch your step because the steps to the basement are RIGHT there! We had our hands full and we're trying to get in the house in the dark and it could have been bad! A door or baby gate there would be helpful in my opinion. Overall my family was very happy with the entire space. Lots of room and all the things we needed were there! Would stay again if necessary.

Denise was quick to respond to any questions.
It is VERY close to Mayo's St Mary's campus and the shuttle stop where you can ride to the other Mayo campus - under 1/4 mile. Likely as close as the parkades and you don't need to pay for parking.
Emergency helicopter noise might be an issue for some - the helicopter landing pad for Mayo is about 300 yards away and there's frequent landings. Some fans are provided that provide good cover noise though they are quite loud.

review_text:
What a sweet, clean, comfortable home:-)
Joshua was a wonderful host who provided everything we needed and more. Everything was functional and very clean. Our family enjoyed a very quiet and relaxing stay. Loved the private backyard to get some fresh air and even in the cold weather, a bit of sunshine. Great water pressure in the shower! I know many people put the water savers in… But then the shower takes twice as long so it’s a moot point. Better to have a nice hot, comforting shower that really helps aches and pains and does the wash and rinse job practically instead of sitting for 20 minutes trying to get soap out of your hair under a drip😂… just saying because we have been Airbnb’n it for 22 months now across the nation and we know a great Airbnb when we find it
…and this is definitely a great one! Super hosting, Joshua! Thank you so much!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Smaller than expected with back door in the bedroom with very little space to access the door. Kitchen has been updated. Bathroom has just enough room with a shower, toilet & sink. There is no counter space and the shower needs a good scrubbing and caulking. The living/dining room is a decent size with table/chairs and a futon not a sleeper couch as advertised. Thankfully we were not there much as the futon makes a terrible couch as in uncomfortable. The A/C is just a window unit in the front room (needs a bit of a cleaning) and this "air conditioning" does not make its way to the bedroom. We found a fan in the closet. The back yard is fenced (needs a bit of attention though) and there is a patio with table, chairs plus umbrella that is broke so not very usable. The yard itself could use a spruce up. Plenty of weeds and old brush piles left behind. So, all of this was okay but the one thing that was not okay was the very damp old house smell. Parking in driveway was a nice feature.

This place is clean, with all the same amenities you would expect at a hotel, with some cooking supplies to cook if you wish. Shower was great with good water pressure and nice hot water. Located in a nice quiet neighborhood, we loved sitting in backyard at night under the stars. It was very relaxing. If we are ever in Rochester again, I will look to see if this place is available to stay.

name: Jennifer
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
This home was perfect for what I needed, a one night stay close to the college. Some things to expect:
The homes are close together so if the next door neighbors are outside, you can hear the noise but that is to be expected in the city.
The access to the backyard is through a door in the bedroom. Not that it matters, but I was just surprised to find a door there.
There isn’t a ceiling fan in the bedroom, not that I needed one, I just like the white noise of one.
There is a window AC unit in the living room, but I didn’t need to use it.
I stayed less than 24 hours but it had everything I needed to make my breakfast. I didn’t use the TV but they provide WiFi and you can use your own Netflix log in.
The home is older so expect that it does have some wear, but the home is cozy, nicely decorated, and I appreciated the personalized note on the whiteboard in the kitchen welcoming me to their home.

name: Nicholas
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: If you're looking for a home-away-from-home, this is the place. This house is in excellent condition in a peaceful and quiet neighborhood that's conveniently located a short drive from downtown Rochester, shopping, and restaurants. The two-car garage with provided garage remote is a wonderful perk, particularly in the middle of a Rochester winter. The kitchen is well-equipped, and the house has comfortable well lit spaces for dining, sitting around watching TV and just relaxing in general. It is a split level, but the stairs are wide half-flights with good railings, and everything you need is on the top floor, so if you can manage a half-flight of stairs except when you're coming or going, then the split-level should not be a problem. The layout of the house is excellent for a family of 4-6 with four bedrooms and three full bathrooms. A good dishwasher, clothes washer and dryer give you all the conveniences of home needed for comfortable longer stays. I highly recommend!

If we had stayed more than one night we would have wanted some furniture in the downstairs main area so we could have had some more room to spread out. The only thing was a big screen TV with no place to sit. (Perhaps there is some remodeling going on we were unaware of). Anyway, that is why the house is rated a 4 star instead of 5 star.
The owner, Denise, seemed very nice in the email contacts I had with her and I’m sure would have been willing to help if we had had any problems. All in all, it was a nice place to stay.
Judi

Stayed with kids
review_text: I highly recommend a stay at Denise's place in Rochester! The location was ideal for us (two families with small children): within walking distance of a park, ~10 minutes to downtown, 20 minutes from Coop's Event Barn, and in a safe neighborhood. We loved the split level features that allowed each family to have its own space. One of the downstairs bedrooms had just a bed, which was perfect for a toddler needing a safe sleeping space. We also loved the playroom and appreciated the family-friendly amenities. Denise was communicative and hospitable, and even gave us early check-in so we could accommodate naps. Denise left check-out instructions on the fridge that we didn't see until we were leaving, but she emphasized that we should only complete them if we had time, since they weren't a part of the home's listing. Thanks, Denise, for the great stay and communication! We look forward to a return visit in the future.

A beautiful home in a quiet neighborhood conveniently located minutes from the Mayo Clinic. Amenities were excellent, clean and comfortable.
My family was scheduled to attend my younger sisters wedding and so we booked this house for Thurs, Friday and Saturday nights. On the Monday just before we were to arrive, our 95 year old mother suddenly passed away. In a sudden flurry of activity to get back to Rochester, I called Denise to see if we could book Tuesday and Wednesday as well, and she was very accommodating.
Her hospitality and can-do attitude was greatly appreciated by myself and my brothers and we will be looking to stay at the same location in the future.
Marty Sehl

name: Ian
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Great beds! Firm but not too firm! House is on a quiet residential street close to walking paths. Two-car garage connects to the lower level. We rarely used the front door. Well-equipped kitchen includes drip coffee maker AND a Keurig! The host even supplied the coffee! Large dining table was perfect for when the grandkids visited. Two large TVs, one upstairs so the adults could watch a movie while the kids played Nintendo (not supplied) downstairs. Plus TVs in two of the upstairs bedrooms. Great beds! A kingsize, a queen and a double plus a bunkbed in the lower level. Three bathrooms meant never having to wait! Master ensuite even has a Jacuzzi bathtub and separate shower! We visited in the winter so didn't use the large deck, barbeque and the big back yard. Had 15 inches of snow during our stay but Nikki, our host, made sure the driveway and sidewalks were clear before we woke up! She's a very attentive, caring host, quick to respond.
Did I say how great the beds are?

name: Mark
rating_info:

January 2022
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: We have stayed in Rochester on four different occasions and at about a half a dozen Airbnbs. This is by far the best place among all of them. First, Nikki and Chad are excellent hosts. They were super responsive and did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. Second, the house is clean, well-maintained, beautifully decorated, and very livable for a family of guests. All of my basics are covered: firm beds, strong water pressure for showers, essentials for cooking (including sharp knives, cookware, and other utensils). A two car garage to keep the cars warm in winter is really great. Additionally, the jacuzzi tub is a real plus. The location is perfect: close to a grocery store and a gas station, and fast and easy to get to Mayo, which was our reason for being here. This is now our “go-to” place for staying in Rochester in the future!

We had a problem with the furnace 1 day but it was handled appropriately so it was never really an issue. Nikki gave us lots of eating options and kept us informed of Changes at the Mayo Clinic because of Covid. Nice quite neighborhood. Would love to stay there again.

Stayed over a week
review_text: We found Nikki's place very homey for our 2 week stay. The furniture was comfortable and we found both the basement and upstairs living room to be relaxing places during down time from visits to the hospital to relax and watch tv, with plenty of throw blankets and pillows for comfort. The kitchen was pretty well stocked with most necessities, with ample room for seating. Having the garage to park a vehicle and bike was a secured feeling. The house is located in a quiet nice neighborhood. The location is close to the bike trails for walking and biking. An easy ten minute drive to St. Mary's hospital so very convenient to get back and forth. We had some nice November days and were able to utilize the back deck and grill and enjoy the beautiful fall views. Nikki was very quick to respond to a small detail with the furnace and get someone there ASAP to address the issue. Nikki was very accommodating with check in and check out times and dates. I would highly recommend Nikki's place.

No downside to this home

review_text:
The house was set up perfectly for our stay. The house itself was very nice and well decorated. The owner left coffee and tea for us, a nice touch. The living room was perfect for gathering and everyone fought to sit on the comfiest chair ever! They had an inviting backyard that was another great place for our family to gather.
The beds were comfortable which is very important for us. The beds were also made with nice soft sheets.
Overall, the family voted that this was one of the top houses we’ve rented. We all loved it.
Another important point to mention is that the owner Nikki, responded to my many questions quickly and was very helpful. I highly recommend this property.
